item.description:
A game of investigation in the Middle Ages. In an ancient kingdom where the vice-king has been murdered and the king asked to his faithful (are they?) dignitary to solve the mistery and find the guilty.
Every single player (from 4 to 6) will trade for clues with the other deciding who is loyal and who is not. For every correct guess, they will gain clues, but betrayals are behind the corner.
Will you be smarter than the other player, charming them to give you the correct cards and fooling them giving the wrong ones?
20 to 60 minutes to discover it! And remember, if you will collect the less amount of clues you will be condamned as a murderer: shame on you!

item.description:
Play your favorite stories from the amazing world of DC Comics in Justice League: Dawn of Heroes, a combat-based adventure game for 2-6 players. The game is divided into missions, each with several chapters. Players are divided into two teams and will battle each other to achieve their respective goals in each chapter. The winning team earns bonuses for the final battle, a face-off between the two teams to decide the fate of the world!

With many beloved characters from the DC Universe, every mission is heavily inspired by well-known stories from our favorite team of superheroes! Take control of Batman, Wonder Woman and the rest of the Justice League to fight against Darkseid, Lex Luthor and many other villains with the Hero team. Or use your many resources to achieve your evil plan with the Villain team, with the help of Joker, Black Manta, Cheetah and many others. The player controlling Batman, for example, needs to manage their hand of cards that represents the gadgets in his utility belt, while the player using Superman will unleash his incredible, almost uncontrollable powers, by rolling dice. Other heroes like the Flash have to manage their action points each turn to perform the best action combination that will lead their team to victory.

The characters have their own set of skills that give them the edge needed to complete their goals, with customized mechanisms to control characters, giving a unique feel to each hero during gameplay to better show off their incredible powers.

Each mission can be played as a full campaign, tackling each chapter and the final battle in one session, but by using the "save system" included in the game, you can play each chapter separately and easily save your progress.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The Reckoners, a game based on the young adult fantasy novels by Brandon Sanderson, allows players to take on the roles of the novels' protagonists and work together to save the world.

Background:
10 years ago... A mysterious burst in the sky gave ordinary men and women extraordinary powers. They're called Epics. But, every Epic turned out to be evil. Today, in the city once known as Chicago (now Newcago), an all-powerful Epic named Steelheart reigns supreme!

Nobody fights back... nobody but the Reckoners! This is where you come in. You are a member of the Reckoners, a skilled group of normal humans who assassinate Epics. Your mission is simple, but not easy. Take down Steelheart and his Epics and save the city.

Gameplay:
The Reckoners is a simultaneous, co-operative game for 1-6 players that plays in 75 minutes. You win by defeating Steelheart. But before you can defeat him, you must first discover his weakness. Throughout the game, you will work with your fellow Reckoners to research and attack Steelheart, but he is not alone. Numerous Epics are scattered throughout the city, and they will wreak havoc upon the population, if left unchecked. If the Epics manage to destroy Newcago by reducing the population to 0, then all Reckoners lose.

The Reckoners determine which actions to take primarily through a simultaneous, dice rolling mechanism, where each player can keep and reroll results up to three times at their own pace. Equipment Cards and Plan Tokens will also allow you to gain extra actions or improve/manipulate the results of your dice. Actions are resolved simultaneously as well, so communication and collaborative planning are key to ensuring optimal outcomes.

Your dice can be used to attack Epics, research Epics, contain Epics, attack Enforcement, earn money, acquire Plan Tokens, move around the game board, remove barricades, and activate special equipment powers. Researching and Attacking Epics will help you earn valuable rewards, including clues about Steelheart's weakness. But, there will always be more Epics than you, so you have to choose your battles wisely. When all actions have been taken by The Reckoners, then it's the Epics turn.

Each round, all of the Epics are going to activate, performing an array of actions and then powering up to be even more devastating next round. Each Epic also has a unique set of actions it performs, so you're always facing multiple threats that function very differently. The crux of the game is deciding how to resolve these competing threats and prioritize your actions together to eliminate Epics and ultimately win the game. How, when, and where you act will determine your victory or failure.

Summary:
In short, The Reckoners plays like a challenging, ever-shifting puzzle. If you like co-operative games where you carefully manage resources, build powerful action combos, create tactical plans with your teammates, and work together to take down the bad guy while on the brink of defeat, then be sure to check out The Reckoners.

—description from the publisher

name.value: LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Original VOL 1

item.description: Gameplay in LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! is team based. A player from each team will place a "Mouthis" around their lips, pulling their lips back and making pronunciation difficult. That player will then attempt to reach a few words from the card they have drawn. They may repeat themselves as often as they would like and must get their teammate(s) to correctly guess the words they are trying to pronounce within 30 seconds. Afterwards the opposing team takes a turn. The first to five or ten points wins!

link.value: LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Family VOL 1
LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Naughty Santa
LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Naughty VOL 1
LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Nice Santa
LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Original VOL 2

name.value: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtle Power Battle Game

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Become a Turtle or one of the bad guys and challenge your friends to an exciting duel."

Simple dice-based combat game based on the Nickelodeon cartoon.

Each player starts with ten numbered power cards. On your turn you roll two dice and can take power cards from your opponents equal to the total rolled. In addition, you roll the character die and take a bonus card if it comes up with your character.

When you take a player's last power card, a you roll off with that player in a duel. If you eliminate a player, you take their character card for use in future rounds. The last character standing is the winner.

Tank Hunter is a simple yet engaging card game featuring all possible tanks from WW2. The players start with a line-up of hidden tanks and can place them in the front line or the back line. Cards can be flipped to be revealed, and revealed tanks can attack other player's tanks.

Tank Hunter 2e Monster is a standalone game that also serves as an expansion for Tank Hunter.

name.value: ATS: The Fight For Hue – Apex of The Vietnam War

item.description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Vietnam with this recreation of the bitter street fighting in the city of Hue, January 31, 1968.
An all new, super detailed map was commissioned for this project, on which tactical-level gamers will battle tooth and nail over The Ming Ca Garrison, The Tay Loc airfield, The Imperial Palace...all the landmarks are there. A selection of all-new scenarios and all of the combat counters required to play out this epic struggle are included.
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook and standard system markers are required

A hungry panda has escaped the zoo in search of better food and the only way to get him back is to gather the bamboo that he likes best. That's where you come in!

In Panda Pursuit, each player is a zookeeper trying to lure Panda back to his enclosure and keep him happy. You'll have to watch what he eats and make sure you stock up on his favorite bamboo to stop him from escaping again. Meanwhile, a sneaky photographer is also chasing Panda to get the perfect set of photos. Could Panda secretly want to be a star?

Each turn players will roll custom dice and apply their results to Panda and their Zookeeper or Panda and the Photographer. When Panda stops on bamboo, he eats it. When a Zookeper stops on bamboo, he collects it. And when the Photographer stops in the same row or column as Panda, he snaps a photo.

Race the other zookeepers to the best bamboo and help or hinder the photographer trying to capture Panda in a variety of poses.

Find the right combination of food and photos to keep Panda happy and home in his enclosure in Panda Pursuit.

item.description:
Skewered and Roasted is an Apples-to-Apples style points based game. There are two decks Events and Memories. Each round, the active player draws a Memory card (which features a situation like "What was my favorite classroom activity") from the deck, then the other players each secretly choose the Event card in hand that best matches that player's history and plays it face-down on the table. The active player then reveals these cards and chooses the Event card that, in their opinion, best matches the Memory card, which he awards to whoever played that Event card. This player earns 1 point, and the active player marker is passed down to the next player.

Once a player has won a number of points, selected from 3 gameplay styles, that player wins.

Battleblade is a skirmish-level fantasy wargame. Usually using less than 10 figures per side, players pit their party of warriors against their opponent's in one of several objective-driven scenarios.

Battleblade uses the same Command & Cohesion mechanic introduced in Laserblade but shifts the focus more towards close combat as well as adding rules for magical attacks, all driven by the roll of a single D10.

Offering a point-based system for character creation, players are free to create the battling party that best matches their playing style.

With games lasting as little as 20 minutes a time, it's possible to complete a whole campaign in an evening, or to play a quick warmup game before settling down to play your mass-battle game of choice...

In XYbrid, players use transparent cards to build monsters in a diabolical quest for infamy.

Exploit biology, robotics, physics and chemistry to assemble myriad abominations—XYbrid parts combine in over half a billion ways.

Players build monsters over 3 rounds by drafting parts (arms, legs, heads, etc.) from a shared pool called the Lab. Mission effects raise the stakes each round, and Breakthrough cards reveal surprises that can dramatically shift the game.

The most infamous player after 3 rounds wins.

item.description:
Soccer: The Board Game is a fast-paced 2-player sports board game that captures the thrill and excitement of soccer. You, the Coach, can lead your team to victory by using real soccer practice and strategies that give your team more chances to score. This board game is pure competitive soccer fun. Challenge someone to a friendly match or start a tournament and take your team to the top!

In this game, each player controls opposing teams. Movement is determined by rolling a die and moving the plans and ball a total number of spaces as determined by the die roll, all within 30 seconds. When a player can attempt a goal, the players determine if it is successful by having a roll off. Penalties are resolved with cards. The game has an included timer so the turns can be kept to 30 seconds and the game to 30 minutes overall.

The Mission: Costa Rica Starter Set comes in a cigar box made from recycled paper. Includes an oversized playmat with an eco-map on the back, 43 cards (4 Endangered, 14 Rare, 23 Common, two limited-edition sketch cards) for a 2-player game, giant learn-to-play cards, bonus CD, and a rulebook Xeko cards are printed on recycled paper with eco-friendly inks. Xeko donates 4% of game net sales to Conservation International.

Additional Mission: Costa Rica cards could be purchased in 9-card booster packs from displays. Mission: Costa Rica added a total of 96 new cards.

Outlawyered is a law based card game that puts players in the the suit and lawsuit of an attorney. Each player is given three clients and must do what they can to be the first to win 5 trials.

Players must use their given Briefcase cards to play various types of Evidence (Ex. Expert Witness and Mistress' Testimony) and Lawyer Tools (Ex. Objections and Outlawyered cards)in order to prevail. Each round sees one player's client get sued by the deck. The player must fight off opposing players to secure their client's freedom, and a trial win. But be careful, just because you win at the trial level does not guarantee a victory at the Super Ultimate Court!!!!

To win at trial the player must keep their client's Trial Score above the designated Trial Card's Conviction Score. Evidence cards can either decrease or increase the Trial Score while Lawyer Tools can dramatically impact the game in various ways, including negating a strong piece of evidence or even changing out which player is on trial.

No legal experience is needed nor will any be gained by playing.

Game description from the publisher:

Version 2 of the Platoon Commander series, with improved art and thicker counters, Tiny Battles introduces India-Pakistan War 1965. India-Pakistan War is a Platoon Commander module simulating the conflict during August and September of 1965 between India and Pakistan in the Chawinda region of Kashmir. The module designer, David K. van Hoose; has brought to life some of the largest armor battles since the Battle of Kursk. The module includes five scenarios that will take the gamer from small skirmishes to the slugfests that produced what has become known as the Grave Yard of Tanks. Fight with Chieftains, Easy Eight Shermans, Pattons, and AMX-13 tanks, insert Guerillas behind the enemy’s lines, and call devastating artillery support. The historically accurate forces are at your command. Can you lead them to victory?

Platoon Commander is a Mark H. Walker designed, platoon-level game system depicting armored combat from 1936 into the near future. The counters represent everything from tanks and infantry to armored personnel carriers and, as the technology progresses, even missile teams. The game uses an innovative sequence of play; a card-assisted system that is partially impulse driven, partially turn-based, and all fun. Morale plays a decisive role, and the period’s equipment is understandably depicted with colors and numbers on each counter. From the designer of Lock ‘n Load, World at War, and Night of Man, Platoon Commander is an exciting, accessible game of strategy and tactics.

Laga Jakarta is a boardgame that depicts urban lifestyle through the various role of people that life inside the capital city, satirically and humorously.

Players collect resources such as Money, Skills, and Prestige to earn Points by fulfilling Dream cards and advancing through Jakarta-related personas represented by the Job cards.

Each turn, an active player receives a Salary before taking an action; distributing all Action tokens from one Action Tile in clockwise/counter-clockwise fashion similar to mancala game (dropping one token for each Tile they passed), thus activating the effect of the Tile where their last token lands.

The game ends when there is no News card left to open. All players then tally their Points and whoever has the most points is the winner.

item.description:
Based on the popular french children series Wickie The Viking.

A set-collection game which used a curved mirror mounted on a 3d game mat. Looking at the reflection of tokens on the mirror players have to decide whether take or not the various tokens.

For 2-4 players.

Hogswallow is an open ended, mythical storytelling game for 2 to 6 players. Players use the primitive imagery on the cards to guide the creation of a cohesive tale. The glyphs on the cards do not have any fixed meanings. They are purposefully pliable, designed to jump start the imagination, and may be interpreted differently from player to player and game to game.

Hogswallow is wonderfully adaptable and suitable for any age and any group, as the stories told are created completely by the participants. The rules provide the three most common variations of play, including one cooperative method, and two competitive ways to play.

In the cooperative version "High Hogswallow", the players take turns adding an element to the story, building off what has come before until one of them wins by bringing the story to satisfactory conclusion.

In the competitive versions, players play only with their own hand of cards to either trump the single card that was played before them in a storytelling battle (Dilly Dallying) or to tell the best story using a limited hand of cards, argue it's merits compared to the other stories, and ultimately vote on whose was the best (Low Hogswallow).

item.description:
Back in 1400 Europe had other borders. Hosts in each country are located and begins the conquest. Can you take possession of other countries and make you strong and powerful?

Purpose of the game:
Fulfill the mission contained in Secret Mission card.

Preparation:

 Each player chooses the color of his army.
 Distribute the 20 territory cards.
 Submit a Secret Mission card to each player.
 Place the armies spread across territories.




Turn:

 Gaining reinforcements.
 Choosing a contact territory to attack the enemy with dice.
 Removing the destroyed armies and moving the conquerors.




Game description in Spanish:
Allá por el año 1400 Europa tenía otras fronteras. Se sitúan los ejércitos en cada país y empieza la conquista. ¿Podrás apoderarte de otros países y hacerte fuerte y poderoso?

Finalidad del juego:
Cumplir la misión que figura en la carta de Objetivo.

Preparación:

 Elegir cada jugador el color de su ejército.
 Repartir las 20 cartas de países.
 Entregar una carta de Objetivo en secreto a cada jugador.
 Colocar los ejércitos repartidos en los países.




Turno:

 Ganar refuerzos.
 Escoger un país enemigo en contacto y atacar con los dados.
 Retirar los ejércitos destruidos y mover a los conquistadores.

Description from the publisher:

Ferali is a disk-flicking game system that comes with nine different game variants that can be played on a octagonal game board with different disk types that come with the game. 
The variants are described in more detail below.


 Rainbow: pocket seven disks in the colors of the rainbow in the correct order (violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, red). The first player to pocket on set of all seven colours wins the game.



 Race to 16: this game uses red and black numbered disks. The first player to pocket exactly 16 points wins the game.



 Poker: each player gets a set of cards and has to pocket the disks with the same numbers as the cards. The player to do this first wins the game.



 Snooker: use to the Ferali game table to play a variant of Snooker using numbered disks.



 Zero is hero: similar to Race to 16. But now a score of zero has to be achieved by adding and subtracting the numbers on the disks.



 Word builder: this game uses disks with characters. Each player pockets disks, writes down the letters, then returns them to the board. Players compete for a predetermined period of time, then they make as many words as possible with their noted letters. Whoever has created the most words wins.



 Cricket: using red and black disks, a cricket game is played on the Ferali board.

Iron League:Black Stadium is a brutal tactical game utilizing Mechs, miniatures and interactive scenery for action-packed game play.

Configure your team with giant machines called Iron Mechs with interchangeable arms and weapons and warriors: the hordes of Claws, the heavy Zimman, your mechanic to repair your mechs. You can recruit mercenaries on your team.

Use drums full of gas in your favor, use walls to protect your warriors and be careful of fire squares. Throw the enemy into the air, or throw them at burning drum. Shoot down the Iron Mech pilots and steal their mechs, or destroy them.

With 4 game Modes: Match, Death Match, Arena and Cooperative. Nuke Tracker is a Expansion full Co-op supplementary to Iron League:Black Stadium.

Match: a tactical and ferocious sports game. Your team can be repaired after each goal.

Death Match: a competitive, destructive combat, if you survive you win. If your team dies, they cannot regenerate.

Arena: Inspired by MOBA style video games, if you destroy 2 enemy black holes or steal your enemy's plasma ball, you win. If your team dies, they can regenerate.

Coop: Survive waves of attacking enemies.

The game consists of 4 teams.

Each team contains 3 Iron Mechs, 3 Claws , 1 Zimman Warrior and 1 Mechanic. Iron Mechs are controlled by pilots with special abilities, but can be taken over by any warrior (mechanics are not warriors). If a warrior takes control of an Iron Mech, he loses his abilities, armor, and special weapons. So, he becomes a pilot but with limitations. There are also 4 mercenaries that can be hired during the game.

link.value: Iron League: Black Stadium – Nuke Tracker

name.value: Thing Two and Thing One Whirly Fun! Game
Thing Two and Thing One Whirly Fun Game

item.description:
Thing One and Thing Two are running around the house making messes! Work together to clean up the house before Mother gets home. If everything is tidy when Mother comes in the door, you all win!

This cooperative game is played inside the box, in which a small model of the house from The Cat in the Hat is built. Through random card draws, the house is messed up by the Things (a spinning top) and re-cleaned by the players.

25th anniversary edition of the famous Trivial Pursuit: A new Disney Family edition with many many questions from Fantasia, Mary Poppins, Snow White and the seven dwarfs, Prince Caspian, Wall-E and many more. Every card has a beautiful picture of the corresponding movie.

The questions vary from easy to difficult and the game contains a new feature; action cards.

Oh no! Monty giant has returned to the city. If Monty stays in our city, it will finish destroying it!

Get calm Monty down and not get angry him or send him to another city.
But be careful, Monty can return at any time.

Monty´ll go city of each player, according to his mood, Monty can damage your city. Try save your city to survive and disturb Monty in the cities of the other players.

All players draw 3 cards, When Monty is in your city players will put cards to change the mood of Monty and if Monty is angry could destroy your city.
Defend your city and get Monty destroy the cities of the other players before your city.

link.value: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

item.description:
Danger is a party card game that is inspired by warning signs amped up to the hilariously absurd. It is a game about bizarre situations and the bizarre ways in which people are saved from them.

The first victim is the person who lives the most dangerously. Each of the other players is called a rescuer. The victim draws and reveals a danger card containing the perilous situation s/he is caught in. The rescuers then place one skill card and one tool card from their hands which they will utilize to save the victim. Each Rescuerer then presents their rescue plan and the Victim awards the Danger card to the Rescuer with the best plan. The first person to win three Dangers is the winner.

A spin-off of the cute and casual card game Tiny Swords, Tactics is a completely new game. Flip, slide, and toss other player's tiles away to be the last one standing.

Keep your tiles close to the Heart of the Battle, and toss your foes away. If a tile is disconnected from all other tiles, that player has until the end of their turn to get it back to the battle or risk losing it forever! Tiles that are face-up can be pushed and tossed, while face-down tiles can act as walls to contain the ever-increasing chaos. Every time you toss a tile, they accumulate more Toss Tokens and get flung further each time, pushing any face-up tiles in their path!

On top of that, each team has their own Captain with unique powers. Utilize each Captain's ability to turn the tide of battle and knock the other players off of your actual table. The whole table is your stage!

item.description: Classic game of Monopoly with a geek twist. Most prominent gameplay change is trivial questions on Community Chest and Chance cards.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description:
Game description from the designer:

Bomb Arena is a party game. Friends can team up to fight against each other. Players work together to put bombs to rival's field and do their best igniting them. Boom!!

It's fun and exciting to use bomb cards and accumulate explosion power with skill cards and team member's help. On the one side, you have to do your best to deal damage to your opponent's team, on the other side, you have to rack your brains removing the bombs in your field.

Players of Bomb Arena usually love to have one more match, two more matches right after the 1st game because it is really fun.
Players keep mesmerized when they play Bomb Arena because every player's movement would affect each other dramatically. You would be excited during the whole game.

HOw to ignite bombs?

There are 3 ways to ignite bombs devil
1. 11 kings of Bomb Cards : No.2 ~ No. 12
We deal 3 bomb cards and 2 skill cards to each player.
Each player take turns placing one bomb card on enemy's field.
When players work together and put 5 bomb cards in a row on enemy's
field, !!BOOM!! It will deal 2 damage to enemy's team.

for example, when you and your team member put
No.2, No.3, No4, No5, No.6 bomb cards on your enemy's field, it explodes.

2. Skill card: Time Bomb
A player can put a time bomb and attache it on a Bomb on enemy's field.

for example, a player can put time bomb on No.7 Bomb card which is already on the filed. then every next player needs to throw 2 dice to
check if it will explode or not. Every player needs to throw 2 dice during the beginning of his turn until the time bomb explodes.

3. When 3 bomb cards of the same number are piled up.
the 3 bomb cards explode immediately can cause 1 point damage.

Players can use counterattack, remove, provoke, designate or other skill cards to make the game more interesting.

item.description:
Crazy Toaster is for younger kids and is a simple game of collecting food.

Sounds simple but the fun part is you put the food in the toaster, the food pops out just like a real toaster and the kids have to catch it in their pans.

Collect all you can but watch out you don't want to catch a rotten fish or you have to give back a piece of toast.

name.value: Ed, the Cat: Wer fährt seine Krallen aus?

item.description:
Ed the cat, Wer fährt seine Krallen aus? is an easy to learn short little card game. The object of the game is to get rid of your hand cards faster than your opponents and collecting as few points as possible. On your turn simply play one of your cards, if one player manages to get rid of all his hand cards at the end of his turn the current round ends and you start a new one. If one player collected 99 or more points at the end of a round the game ends and the player with the fewest points wins.

Game description from the back of the box:

Dieses Kartenspiel hat es in sich:
Es ist so einfach wie Mau-Mau - und doch so listig wie ein Miezekätzchen.
Wer verpasst seinen Mitspielern die meisten Strafpunkte, ohne selbst welche zu bekommen?
Und wer wird als Ersters seine Karten los?

9-Masu Shogi is played on a tiny three-by-three square board using only eight of the original Shogi’s types of pieces.

Movements and the goal of checkmate remain, but unlike regular Shogi there are 40 different starting positions to choose from.

item.description:
Players travel a path from the top of the board to the bottom by playing cards. Cards can also be used to impede opponents.

Cards either have a number (1-5) of squares to move in one direction, a "star" that lets a player advance to a corner or fork, a "circled star" that allows a player to move another player's piece to a star square, or an "X" that forces a player to skip a turn.

This game is an homage to the great designer Alex Randolph. Basically, it is Ricochet Robots made with a postcard. A player throws a postcard at the center of a table, all the players try to figure out what is the minimum amount of overturn on its side the postcard must do to touch the edge of the table, the player that said the smallest number must check the claim. If he/she was right the player cuts the first border of the postcard (see the image) and keep it as a token of his/her points. Otherwise the player cuts the border and crumple it up as a negative point. the postcard is now more irregular and smaller, therefore is harder to guess right. If a player collect 2 crumpled up tokens is out of the game, the game end when everybody is eliminated or the card cannot be cut anymore (end of the dotted lines. The survived player in the first case or the player with the most stars in their token in the second case is the winner.

Stellar Armada is a starship combat wargame for two players that deletes the complexities of maneuvering in favor of focusing on system management.

Each player has a game mat with representations of ship systems. Players take turns activating ship systems in an attempt to destroy their opponent.

Gameplay is a balance of decision making and luck. The game uses dice to determine outcomes, but allows for probabilities to be adjusted by expending ship resources. These resources dwindle throughout gameplay forcing players to take greater risks.

item.description:
When humans were tired of dreary monoculture and the dull design products of the food industries, they decided to provide each citizen with a piece of land to make them self-sufficient. In order to use the area in an optimal way, the smartest of them drew on a cultivation method that includes the dimension of height and brings out naturally grown stories: the agroforestry. Thus, the woodland gardeners were born, and they now face the task of transforming their wasteland into a productive garden of trees and shrubs with edible fruits and seeds. There are several factors to be considered when laying out the gardens: the light and space requirements of the fruit trees, as well as the time of their flowering and maturing, and whether a species needs a partner for fertilization. Otherwise, the players' efforts will not result in a rich harvest.

Who cultivates the most valuable woodland garden in Waldgärtner wins. Gaining the right cards, and placing or discarding them at the right time will lead to your horticultural success!

A card game of courtly politics and intrigue
His Royal Majesty is dying. Stricken with sudden illness our king failed to anoint a successor. Now a ruthless game begins between his sons, daughters and bastards.

Outmaneuver your rivals.
Gain support of key figures at the court.
Become the next king.

In Interregnum, 3-5 players strive to build a coterie of influential nobles, courtiers and soldiers who will support their claim to the throne. Important members of the court can help persuade others to join your cause, but even lowly servants often hear rumours that you may use as leverage.
Other contenders will use whatever influence they have to stop you, so rotten compromises and short-term alliances will be necessary on the way.

On each of his turns the active player chooses one character card he wishes to recruit and one or more cards that strengthen the bid. Other players may then decide to forfeit cards from their hands in order to block the recruitment.

On a successful recruitment the character (card) stays in play and provides ongoing benefits as well as Power (VP) to the owner.

Once a player gathers enough Power he or she may proclaim victory.

Only if you play your cards right and outsmart the competition - the crown will be yours.

name.value: Mutiny: A Pirate's Jolly Game of Dice and Back-Stabbing

item.description:
In Mutiny: A Pirate's Jolly Game of Dice and Backstabbing, players take on the roles of 2-6 pirates, trying to horde gold while attempting to escape a steadily sinking ship. In this case, the captain may not go down with the ship, but you can bet everyone else will!

Mutiny was introduced in concept during the 2014 rpggeek.com VirtuaCon digital convention event. At that time it was called "Pirates of the Sinking Ship".

The rules for Mutiny are simple: Using five, or perhaps six, standard dice, players roll for values of 3-5, hoping to amass wealth, 6's to board the lifeboat on which the gold is stored, while attempting to avoid 1's and 2's, which sink the ship.

When the ship reaches a water level of 20 fathoms, the ship sinks, with all aboard except whichever clever pirate has snuck aboard the lifeboat and made away with the treasure.

This game also includes Rum cards, which can be spent to gain initiative to roll dice. However, when a player's number is rolled, his rum card must be spent. Therefore, all players will receive an opportunity to roll the dice (and hopefully board the lifeboat) at least once.

Mutiny is played over a course of 3 separate games. Player character abilities shift each game, and are related to numbers also used to initiate a player's turn.

1) When this player is aboard the lifeboat, 1's rolled increase the water level by 2 fathoms.

2) This player may reroll any 2's rolled during his turn.

3) This player may keep his Rum card until he chooses to spend it to take his turn.

4) This player adds 2 gold to the lifeboat whenever he rolls a 4.

5) This player acquires 1 gold for his own personal pocket whenever anyone rolls his number during turn initiation. (The gold is added to his score at game end, provided he has won at least one of the three games.)

6) This player rolls six dice, instead of 5.

May the best backstabbing mutineer win!

After many millennia, Hypnos is leaving the throne. Now it belongs to the Morpheus, Hypnos' right hand and son. Morpheus must make sure that dreams leave Oniria to the world and minds of mortals at the same rate as to this moment, otherwise Earth is doomed to regress of thinking and Oniria – to annihilation. Mortals need dreams to think, remember and stimulate their imagination, Oniria needs sleeping humans to exist – without dreamers Oniria will be left without power. But Morpheus cannot rule Kingdom of Dreams and create dreams and send them alone. That is why he needs an assistant. He makes a competition – Dreamweavers have three months (this is rather foggy, time in Oniria works – like most things – differently than in mortal world) to weave the most dreams with the most powerful oniric energies – the best weaver will become Morpheus’ right hand, and simultaneously second most powerful creature in Oniria.

Morpheus is a game for 2-4 players in which players will create dreams. At the beginning of each turn, the active player rolls the dice. Then, players will choose the dice and according to the number they will get different gifts, with essence among them. After that, at certain locations Dreamweavers can assign the essence to dreams and completing them. Other gifts include Chronite, a rare mineral able to bend time, used as a currency and Onirite, a device which can bend the structure of Oniria, allowing players to take additional actions. Dreamweavers will travel through the land of Oniria exactly three months of game-time, which equals 21 turns. The board is randomly assembled from tiles and dreamweavers will go a full circle from location to location. Player who creates the most powerful dreams and collects the most victory points wins the game and becomes right hand and assistant of Morpheus.

item.description: Pakjesavond is a micro game about Sinterklaas and the missing presents. Up to five players try to find the location of these presents using the powers of the Pieten (played by children in the images) and Sinterklaas himself. The player who finds most presents by the end of the game is considered to be the best helper by Sinterklaas and wins the game.

All the ants want to return to their home in Cross Roads, so they jostle back and forth among the other crawling critters, but the way home isn't easy because if a strong scent crosses your path, you'll fall back and lose valuable time.

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

This (2016) is a very special year for GRANNA - we are celebrating our 25th anniversary! Throughout all this time we have tried to provide all of you with the best games - the kind we would like to play ourselves. We would like you to celebrate this very special anniversary together with us. For this occasion we have prepared a little surprise. Open the box and enter the land of good games. Thank you for being with us!

The game 25 consists of a deck of 54 double-faced cards. They show pieces of the covers of 6 games published by Granna. Each cover picture is divided into 6 pieces. Each card's 2 sides show pieces from the same position of 2 different cover pictures. Each specific piece of a cover appears on 3 different cards in the deck. In a 2-player game, the goal is to make 2 complete pictures on the table. With 3 and 4 players, the goal is to make 1 complete picture on the table and collect 1 piece each of the 5 other pictures.

item.description:
Apokalypse was a miniature wargame set in a dystopian future, the aftermath of the final war. It simulated the desperate skirmishes, firefights and encounters taking place in the last 120 days of humanity. The players took the role of powermongers, leaders and warlords of what armed forces still existing in the postapocalyptic wasteland, using remaining survivors as tools to enforce their agenda.

It was stated Apokalypse used 25mm miniatures but since that scale later came to be known as (non-heroic) 28mm you could generally say that 28mm is the default standard for the game. The length measure unit, "meters", was intentionally meant for being adapted to whatever scale of minis you had access to, making the game playable with all scales of miniatures.

When Hardcore Media was liquidated, around 1998-99, the game faded into obscurity and very much stayed that way.
In 2016 it was made available online, as a freeware document with the creators' consent, through a fan-made PDF of the original rulebook (available in the Web Links section).

There were occasional references to expansions throughout the core rulebook. The material for all of these was sadly destroyed when Hardcore Media folded and its creators moved on to different projects. Apokalypse was a fully finished product and contains all the rules and information needed to play, despite this.

name.value: Het Stratégisch Spel, Of Militaire Uitspanning
Le Jeu Stratégique ou Délassemens Militaires

item.description:
Wargame published in the Netherlands and Germany in 1819 for teaching military strategy. It was sold in a wooden box containing a rulebook, 2 dice, 52 rectangular wooden playing pieces representing military units, and an 18.5 inches square topographic map.

Units move from crossroad to crossroad on the point-to-point map. Terrain affects unit movement and combat, and players also need to use their mobile magazines to provide supply for their army. The goal of the game is to capture the enemy capital. A player can also win by surrounding or eliminating a large enough portion of the enemy army.

Combat is mostly deterministic with rules for how many of different types of units are required to successfully attack a position, modified by map terrain, but players under some circumstances roll the dice to resolve combats.

link.value: De Weduwe J. Allart en Comp

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scratch Wars is close to a collectible game, but in certain game modes it's closer to a board game and can be also played online through a phone application for iOS and Android.

In more detail, to start playing Scratch Wars you need only two cards: one hero and one weapon. The cards are unique in several aspects. You can scratch them like lottery tickets, but by doing so you are not destroying or devaluing them. Each hero card is unique; each hero has a unique name and value generated. No one else in the world will have the same card! Slowly uncover the card by scratching it and in combination with unique values, it is pleasantly thrilling. Cards can even be bought individually. (Would you rather have a hero or a weapon?)

With an increasing number of weapon cards, you can try a sophisticated one-on-one duel in which you equip your hero with up to five weapons, then think strategically to find out which one to use when. The duel itself is very interesting; you spin a special circular weapon: turntable paper on a stick. The hero has certain levels of energy which you spend using various weapons. Heroes can change weapons during the turn and their proper use is the focus of the game. The game is risk management; you are trying to spend the hero's energy for the best possible effects. According to the composition of effects, you choose weapon, strategy and risk. You can attack the opponent's weapon, his permanent effects, or the hero directly. You have to decide when to repair a weapon, when to save energy for the hit with more powerful weapons, etc.

Once you get into the basic game, you can try a more comprehensive and strategic mode in which teams of heroes compete against each other. Then you can move to the top mode where entire armies of heroes collide. With more than two players, it is possible to play in teams or each player plays by themselves with modified rules. The game is perfect for tournaments.

If you want to play with just one player, simply scan the card into your phone and you can play online. There is a varied range of options at your disposal, from tournaments and hero trainings to territorial fights. The goal is to level your hero up and obtain spells for him. As the first game in the world, Scratch Wars presents digital ownership so that what you have physically, you also have digitally. If you later want to replace or sell any of your heroes, you can change them digitally with all that is recorded on the card, i.e., with all the spells and experiences.

If you would rather play the game more as a board game and add more strategic options, you will be able to expand the game with "trade" cards or hero's "abilities".

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Flipped Off is a tactical card game where you play a plotting Mastermind aiming to defeat your rivals and seize control of the city for yourself. You must manage your Minions - the Pirates, Ninjas, and Robots that do your bidding, play actions that can improve your situation or wreak havoc with your enemies, and use your Minions to launch attacks and hope that your rivals can’t turn the cascade of results to their own advantage.

Each player has a set of Minion cards that they can use to attack other players, and a set of Action cards in their hand that they can use to affect either their own minions, or other player's minions. The objective of the game is to use your Minions and Actions to attack the other players and reduce their health until only a single player remains.

A Minion attacks by triggering another active Minion on the board. When a Minion is triggered it has an effect - it can deal damage to players, it can heal a player, or it can add flip counters to another Minion. But be careful! Attacking a Minion can cause a chain reaction that is out of your control. Each Minion has 2 different effects on either side of its card - each time it triggers it has a different effect on the game, and then it flips to reveal the opposite side. Minions also have a limited number of flips, once they're spent they are removed from play.

Can you out-think your opponents? Can you take advantage of the Minions on the board in order to come out on top? Eliminate your rivals and seize control of the city. Or at the very least, take all your rivals out with you and have the strongest army of Minions left who can secure the city for your successor.

3UP 3DOWN is a fast-paced, family-friendly discard game with a surprising finish!

THE GOAL: Get rid of your cards before your family and friends can get rid of theirs.

THE SURPRISE: Three of your cards are not revealed until the very end - so you will need both strategy and luck!

And, since 3UP 3DOWN takes just 3 minutes to learn & 10 minutes to play, it's so fast and fun, you'll all say, "Let's Play Another Round!"

Set Collecting and “Take That” game play

Asymmetrical and Cooperative action

Players play as ordinary citizens that come together in a desperate attempt to defend Metroville from the threat of a Villain (played by 1 player) who is set on destroying Metroville and all its citizens.

The asymmetrical game play allows for the Villain to feel ultra powerful by playing special Villain Cards and Disaster Cards. Citizens collect sets of reinforcements that include Firefighters, Police, Military, and City Guard to help fight back against the Villain. Watch out because the Villain can capture these reinforcements and make sets of their own.

—description from the publisher

HoldFast Atlantic recreates the ship battles contesting control of the Atlantic Ocean during World War II. The navies of Britain and the United States are challenged to keep sea lanes open for its convoys. German U-Boats prowl these waters and German and Italian battleships and cruisers threaten the sea supply lines of the Allies. The great Axis warships Bismarck, Tirpitz and others contest Britain's best while the United States fleet adds its might to the fight as the war progresses. As the Axis player can you cut the sea lanes that supply Great Britain and Russia to win the war? Or as the Allied player, can you overcome the U-Boat menace and Axis naval and air forces to control the Atlantic.

HoldFast Pacific has the empire of Japan attempt to control the vast Pacific Ocean. After devastating the United States fleet at Pearl Harbor, the Japanese naval, air and land forces push their conquest across the Pacific. Their only obstacles are weakened Allied forces and time as the Allies recover. Can you as the Japanese player secure a Pacific empire that protects your homeland from your enemies? And as the Allied player can you rebuild your armed forces and mount a counter attack that prevents the Japanese expansion and bring the war to their homeland?

item.description:
Tides of Fate is a nautical fantasy strategy game set in the world of Thes'lia. The game supports 2-6 players with faction vs faction and free for all variants. Strategize and coordinate with allies to defeat the opposing faction by battling ships, conquering islands and sieging capitals.

The game revolves around five major mechanics. Movement, resources, expansion, combat, and fate. These mechanics allow for numerous different strategies while offering enough probability and luck to keep players on the edge of their seat throughout the whole game.

The world is split between two factions, the Congregant and the Derelict. The Congregant are the Avarie, Lokar, and Naerath nations. They believe in a prophecy foretold by ancient priests that the gods would return and bring harmony back to the people and Thes’lia. The Derelict are the Rogand, Kondrei, and Vayunne nations. They believe the era of gods have come to an end and wish to bring Thes’lia into a new era of revolution.

These conflicting ideologies have brought much strife between the two factions. The Hallowed Isles have become the only reliable origin for resources, causing the land and oceans surrounding them to become theaters of war.

name.value: Rage Quitter or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Flip the Table

item.description: In Rage Quitter, each player competes in a dexterity challenge to see who can collect the most game pieces from the scattered ruins of table. On each players turn, after collecting game pieces, they will flip a table(card) from their deck with two pieces on it and try not fling them off the table. After flipping a table, the player then gets to throw a table(card) to cover up the pieces on the table, so no other player can get to them.

A strategic faction based die stacking and siege game. Take control of an elemental faction waging war over ancient ruins. Earn points by rebuilding ruins as high as you can; however, be wary of your adversaries who will try and knock them down with their siege engines. As seen at PAX West 2016 in the Indie Megabooth.

Each turn players perform an action to explore new territory, move or fire their siege engine, or take control of territory with their leader. Then they roll dice to build up the ancient ruins on the board. The taller a ruin is, the more points it is worth but the bigger target it is to be knocked down by an enemy siege engine. Dice knocked out of play are captured and worth points at the end of the game.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most points currently on the board wins. There are five different scoring objectives (ruin height, color matching, captured enemy dice, faction objectives, and your faction leader's control) which can all contribute to your victory.

Forestaurant is a cooperative board game in which the players are tasked to manage a restaurant for animals. Various species can visit your restaurant, and you have to be aware of their different tastes: watch where you seat them, which meal you suggest them, and how you prepare the food.

Your goal is to earn the respect of every species. To accomplish this, you have time until closing, which comes after the deck runs out. And watch out, if the guests are discontent, you can lose the game earlier!

Players take turns one after the other, and their turn consists of three phases. In the Activation phase, a row or column of tables are activated based on the top card of the deck. The activated guests may advance to their next state or their stress levels can increase. The second phase is the Action phase, where the player can take various actions: seat new guests, take orders, prepare and serve meals, and buy ingredients. The player has to play a card for each action, and based on the type of the card, the interaction can decrease or increase the stress level of the guest. In the Ending phase, the player discards the ingredients exceeding the storage limit, and draws new cards. The most interesting part is the preparation of meals, where other players can also play cards and pay ingredients to help the current player.

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

CONGO is a game of adventure played with miniatures and taking place in a unexplored, fantasized, wild, dangerous and enchanted Africa, as imagined by newspapers at the end of the 19th century.

Playing a game of Congo, you might head a scientific expedition, a ferocious tribe, a group of slave traffickers out of Zanzibar or take command of a warband of Azandes, defending to their last drop of blood their culture and their lands!

Each Player's column will be made up of around 30 figures, including colourful characters.

The Adventures related by Le Bulletin de la Société Géographique are at the heart of the game. As you live them out, you will cross a giant ape protected by fierce guardians, try to take back a princess captures by Zanzibari slavers, and cross rivers teeming with crocodiles... Thanks to sheer perseverance, you may even discover the source of the Congo river itself.

Congo is, however, a hostile environment in which wild animals and witchcraft abound... Not to mention many other surprises.

link.value: Congo Mary: The Throne of Thunder

item.description:
Incantesium is a card game where 2-5 wizards face each other in a magic duel through elemental spells.
Each player starts with 10 cards and the purpose is to terminate the opponent cards.
Each turn a player throws a spell following the magic flow of the card on the table: if the flow is correct (same or opposite element of the last played card) the spell is active and he can cure himself or attack an opponent.

item.description:
Welcome to the ancient and wondrous city of Jadid. Its streets are a bustling hive of activity. Traders and merchants doing business and how do tehir goods get transported? A network of flying carpet couriers deliver these goods from one location to another!

In this magical, fun game you play delivery men trying to fulfill contracts. Really? Yes, but you're not ordinary delivery men! Your delivery vehicle is a genie-powered flying carpet and you're roaring through twisting and turning city streets in a frenzied race to make the biggest profit.

Grab the most lucrative contract or be sneaky and steal one from a rival! Ram your opponents' carpets into buildings or target them with genie power-ups! Spend coin to boost your carpet's abilities and avoid the mischievous genie wandering around town!

In Genie Express: 1001 Deliveries, players move to a location on the modular board to pick up contracts and then plotting a course to the drop off location. Movement is determined by rolling a pool of special movement dice. Completing a contract gains you gold. A player wins by getting to a pre-determined amount of gold first. Players compete to pickup the limited number of contracts so you better be quick otherwise your rivals will beat you to the winning goal!

Phineas and Ferb have a mission: They want to build the coolest rollercoaster in the world. With tactival thinking and luck, you can make it together. But beware: taddle-tale Candace and the mean Dr. Doofenschrmirtz will do everything to destroy the build!

The player flips a few coins. If they land with the right side up, they get to move their token. This way they can collect pieces of their own puzzle, which shows a picture of the Rollercoaster! The first one to collect all the different pieces, AND makes it to the House, wins!
There is a risk, though. Candace can also move, and when she gets home before one of the players, she will tell mom and the plan is foiled!

Venture Party is a fun and simple, 3-7 player, hand management game. Fantasy themes and RPG tropes are turned on their heads in this game full of clumsy and unfortunately ill-fated heroes. Your job, as leader of your Venture Party, is to decide which characters are putting their lives on the line for the team. Discard the unlucky heroes and collect loot to build the strongest party! With the new 16 card built in expansion pack, there is even more potential for mayhem before you reach the bottom of the deck! The land is ripe with opportunity, and only one Venture Party will come out on top. Will it be yours?

The game begins by dealing 2 Party Members, and 1 Loot Token to every player. At the start of each player turn, they must draw one party member and play one party member from their hand. These heroes are disposable, each with a Power Level value from 1 to 16. Every number has varying effects depending on their Power Level (gathering loot, removing player cards, look at a players hand etc.) Since a Loot Token adds +1 to your party's overall power, Loot handling can sometimes make the difference between the winning and losing parties.

WINNING: When the deck runs out the game is over. You want to end the game with the strongest venture party. The strength of your party is determined by combining the numbers on your cards with the number of loot tokens you have you your possession.

Ex: If Pedro has the Necromancer (Level 12) and the Blind Monk (Level 6) and 5 Loot, his score is
12 + 6 + 5 =23
